sage.shader.glsl

Class GLSLShaderProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.shader.ShaderProgram
      • sage.shader.glsl.GLSLShaderProgram

  • public class GLSLShaderProgram
extends ShaderProgram
    GLSLShaderProgram represents a shader written in the GLSL shading language. By default, debugging of shaders is enabled which will print any compiler or linker errors to the console.
    Author:
    Morgan Darke

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl)
        Description copied from class: ShaderProgram
        This method will initialize the ShaderProgram by compiling and linking the Vertex and Fragment shaders. Since currently only OpenGL shaders are supported, this method takes a GL2 object as a parameter. This should be changed later to accommodate shaders written in other languages.
        Specified by:
        init in class ShaderProgram
        Parameters:
        gl - An active GL context

      • useShader

        public void useShader(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl)
        This method will make the program the current shader.
        Specified by:
        useShader in class ShaderProgram
        Parameters:
        gl - An active GL2 context

      • useFixedFunction

        public void useFixedFunction(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl)
        This function will unbind the shader program and the fixed function pipeline will be used instead.
        Specified by:
        useFixedFunction in class ShaderProgram
        Parameters:
        gl -

        public int getProgramID()
        This function returns the ID used to identify the shader program.
        Specified by:

      • addUniform

        public void addUniform(GLSLUniform<?> uniform)
        This function associates a uniform variable with the shader. However, the uniform variable is not yet bound to a location.
        Specified by:
        addUniform in class ShaderProgram
        Parameters:
        uniform - The uniform variable

      • getUniform

        public GLSLUniform<?> getUniform(java.lang.String name)
        This function gets the uniform variable associated with the specified name.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the uniform variable
        Returns:
        The uniform variable

      • enableDebugging

        public static void enableDebugging(boolean debug)
        This method will toggle debugging information for the shader on or off. If debugging is enabled the compile or link error will be printed to the console.
        Parameters:
        debug - true if debugging information is to be enabled, false otherwise.

      • applyUniformVariables

        public void applyUniformVariables(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl)
        Description copied from class: ShaderProgram
        This method sets values for all uniform variables used by the shader. In order for the values to be applied, the ShaderProgram must be the active program.
        Specified by:
        applyUniformVariables in class ShaderProgram
        Parameters:
        gl - An active GL context

      • setUniformValue

                                E value)
        Description copied from class: ShaderProgram
        This method will set the value for the uniform variable with the given name.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the variable
        value - The value to set
